citation.article-title: Paramoritella alkaliphila gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the family Moritellaceae isolated in the Republic of Palau.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Paramoritella (Pa.ra.mo.ri.tel′la. Gr. prep. para beside; N.L. fem. n. Moritella a bacterial genus name; N.L. fem. n. Paramoritella beside Moritella).
Cells are Gram-negative, chemo-organotrophic, facultatively anaerobic, require seawater for growth, are motile by means of subpolar flagella and are positive for oxidase and catalase.
The predominant fatty acids are 14 : 0, 16 : 0, 16 : 1ω7c and 18 : 1ω7c (Table 2) and the respiratory quinone is Q-8.
This genus belongs to the class Gammaproteobacteria and the type species is Paramoritella alkaliphila.
Fatty acid profiles of strains A3F-7T and ssthio04PA2-7c
Values are percentages of total fatty acids.
